alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:55AM EDT until July 20 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LIVINGSTON...CENTRAL MARSHALL...NORTHWESTERN TRIGG AND LYON COUNTIES... At 1055 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Calvert City, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Benton, Calvert City, Eddyville, Hillman Ferry Campground, Golden Pond Visitors Center, Energy Lake Campground, Woodlands Nature Station, Birmingham Ferry Recreation Area, Demumbers Bay Campground, Land Between The Lakes Area, Cravens Bay Campground, Canton, Rockcastle, Kuttawa and Grand Rivers. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 23 and 55. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 42 and 68. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
